com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.controller.components

Class WheelTrackerMember.Wheel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.controller.components.WheelTrackerMember.Wheel
  • Enclosing class:
    WheelTrackerMember

    public static class WheelTrackerMember.Wheel
extends java.lang.Object
    Tracks the position of a wheel by looking at past positions, or alternatively, walking the tracks to satisfy the wheel-to-center distance.

    • Constructor Summary

      • getUp

        public org.bukkit.util.Vector getUp()
        Gets the up unit vector. This is the vector upwards, which controls the angle of the Minecart around the set of wheels. This is particularly important for rails like upside-down rails and vertical rails.
        Returns:
        up vector

      • getForward

        public org.bukkit.util.Vector getForward()
        Gets the forward unit vector. This is the direction the wheel is moving on the rails, not the orientation of the wheel. For calculating the orientation, it must be calculated whether the Minecart is moving into the orientation or opposite of it.
        Returns:
        forward vector

      • update

        public void update()
        Recalculates the position of this wheel
